children.text: oṃ
children.translated_text: Om

children.text: mano hi dvividhaṃ proktaṃ śuddhaṃ cāśuddham eva ca /
children.translated_text: The mind is indeed said to be of two kinds, pure and impure,

children.text: aśuddhaṃ kāmasaṃkalpaṃ śuddhaṃ kāmavivarjitam // BrbUp_1 //
children.translated_text: the impure is filled with desire, the pure is devoid of desire.

children.text: mana eva manuṣyāṇāṃ kāraṇaṃ bandhamokṣayoḥ /
children.translated_text: The mind alone is the cause for bondage and liberation of men,

children.text: bandhāya viṣayāsaktaṃ muktyai nirviṣayaṃ smṛtam // BrbUp_2 //
children.translated_text: attachment to objects is for bondage, non-attachment is considered for liberation.

children.text: yato nirviṣayasyāsya manaso muktir iṣyate /
children.translated_text: Since liberation of this mind is desired when it is devoid of objects,

children.text: tasmān nirviṣayaṃ nityaṃ manaḥ kāryaṃ mumukṣuṇā // BrbUp_3 //
children.translated_text: therefore, the mind should always be made free of objects by the seeker of liberation.

children.text: nirastaviṣayāsaṅgaṃ saṃniruddhaṃ mano hṛdi /
children.translated_text: When the mind, devoid of attachment to objects, is restrained in the heart,

children.text: yadā yāty unmanībhāvaṃ tadā tat paramamadam // BrbUp_4 //
children.translated_text: then it attains the state of <s>Unmani</s>, which is the supreme bliss.

children.text: tāvad eva niroddhavyaṃ yāvaddhṛdi gataṃ kṣayam /
children.translated_text: It should be restrained until it reaches dissolution in the heart,

children.text: etaj jñānaṃ ca mokṣaṃ ca ato 'nyo granthavistaraḥ // BrbUp_5 //
children.translated_text: this is knowledge and liberation; all else is an extension of texts.

children.text: naiva cintyaṃ na cācintyam acintyaṃ cintyam eva ca /
children.translated_text: It is neither to be thought of nor not thought of; it is indeed beyond thought and thought itself,

children.text: pakṣapātavinirmuktaṃ brahma sampadyate tadā // BrbUp_6 //
children.translated_text: free from biases, one attains <s>Brahman</s> then.

children.text: svareṇa saṃdhayed yogam asvaraṃ bhāvayet param /
children.translated_text: One should unite with <s>Yoga</s> through sound, meditate on the ultimate without sound,

children.text: asvareṇa hi bhāvena bhāvo nābhāva iṣyate // BrbUp_7 //
children.translated_text: for by the state without sound, existence is not non-existence.

children.text: tad eva niṣkalaṃ brahma nirvikalpaṃ nirañjanam /
children.translated_text: That alone is the undivided <s>Brahman</s>, without alternatives, stainless,

children.text: tad brahmāham iti jñātvā brahma sampadyate dhruvam // BrbUp_8 //
children.translated_text: knowing 'I am that <s>Brahman</s>', one certainly becomes <s>Brahman</s>.

children.text: nirvikalpam anantaṃ ca hetudṛṣṭāntavarjitam /
children.translated_text: Without alternatives, infinite, devoid of cause and example,

children.text: aprameyam anādyaṃ ca jñātvā ca paramaṃ śivam // BrbUp_9 //
children.translated_text: knowing the immeasurable, beginningless and supreme <s>Śiva</s>.

children.text: na nirodho na cotpattir na vandyo na ca śāsanam /
children.translated_text: There is no cessation, no origination, no one to worship, no governance,

children.text: na mumukṣā na muktiś ca ity eṣā paramārthatā // BrbUp_10 //
children.translated_text: no desire for liberation, no liberation, this is the ultimate truth.

children.text: eka evātmā mantavyo jāgratsvapnasuṣuptiṣu /
children.translated_text: The one <s>Ātman</s> should be contemplated in waking, dreaming, and deep sleep,

children.text: sthānatrayād vyatītasya punarjanma na vidyate // BrbUp_11 //
children.translated_text: for one who transcends the three states, there is no rebirth.

children.text: eka eva hi bhūtātmā bhūte bhūte vyavasthitaḥ /
children.translated_text: The one <s>Ātman</s> indeed resides in each being,

children.text: ekadhā bahudhā caiva dṛśyate jalacandravat // BrbUp_12 //
children.translated_text: seen as one and many, like the moon reflected in water.

children.text: ghaṭasaṃbhṛtam ākāśaṃ līyamāne ghaṭe yathā /
children.translated_text: Just as the space within a pot merges when the pot is dissolved,

children.text: ghaṭo līyeta nākāśaṃ tadvaj jīvo ghaṭopamaḥ // BrbUp_13 //
children.translated_text: the pot merges, not the space; similarly, the <s>Jīva</s> is like the pot.

children.text: ghaṭavad vividhākāraṃ bhidyamānaṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
children.translated_text: Like a pot with various forms, breaking again and again,

children.text: tadbhagnaṃ na ca jānāti sa jānāti ca nityaśaḥ // BrbUp_14 //
children.translated_text: it does not know its own destruction, yet it knows eternally.

children.text: śabdamāyāvṛto yāvat tāvat tiṣṭhati puṣkare /
children.translated_text: Covered by the illusion of sound, it remains in the lotus,

children.text: bhinne tamasi caikatvam ekam evānupaśyati // BrbUp_15 //
children.translated_text: when the darkness is pierced, it perceives the oneness alone.

children.text: śabdākṣaraṃ paraṃ brahma yasmin kṣīṇe yad akṣaram /
children.translated_text: The imperishable sound, the supreme <s>Brahman</s>, in which the imperishable resides,

children.text: tad vidvān akṣaraṃ dhyāyed yadīcchecchāntim ātmanaḥ // BrbUp_16 //
children.translated_text: the wise one should meditate on the imperishable if he desires peace for the self.

children.text: dve vidye veditavye tu śabdabrahma paraṃ ca yat /
children.translated_text: Two knowledges are to be known, the <s>Śabda-Brahman</s> and that which is supreme,

children.text: śabdabrahmaṇi niṣṇātaḥ paraṃ brahmādhigacchati // BrbUp_17 //
children.translated_text: one who is skilled in <s>Śabda-Brahman</s> attains the supreme <s>Brahman</s>.

children.text: grantham abhyasya medhāvī jñānavijñānatattvataḥ /
children.translated_text: The wise one, having studied the texts, in essence of knowledge and wisdom,

children.text: palālam iva dhānyārthī tyajed grantham aśeṣataḥ // BrbUp_18 //
children.translated_text: like a seeker of grain discards the husk, should completely abandon the texts.

children.text: gavām anekavarṇānāṃ kṣīrasyāpy ekavarṇatā /
children.translated_text: Of cows of various colors, the milk has indeed one color,

children.text: kṣīravat paśyate jñānaṃ liṅginas tu gavāṃ yathā // BrbUp_19 //
children.translated_text: like milk, knowledge is seen in the embodied, just as with cows.

children.text: ghṛtam iva payasi nigūḍhaṃ bhūte bhūte ca vasati vijñānam /
children.translated_text: Like ghee hidden in milk, knowledge resides in each being,

children.text: satataṃ manthayitavyaṃ manasā manthānabhūtena // BrbUp_20 //
children.translated_text: constantly churned by the mind, which is like the churning rod.

children.text: jñānanetraṃ samādāya cared vahnim ataḥ param /
children.translated_text: Taking the eye of knowledge, one should proceed beyond the fire,

children.text: niṣkalaṃ nirmalaṃ śāntaṃ tad brahmāham iti smṛtam // BrbUp_21 //
children.translated_text: the undivided, pure, peaceful, that is remembered as 'I am <s>Brahman</s>'.

children.text: sarvabhūtādhivāsaṃ ca yad bhūteṣu vasaty adhi /
children.translated_text: That which resides as the abode of all beings,

children.text: sarvānugrāhakatvena tad asmy ahaṃ vāsudeva // BrbUp_22 //
children.translated_text: by being the benefactor of all, I am that <s>Vāsudeva</s>.
